TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DataPagerField extends System.Object implements class System.Web.UI.IStateManager

Docs.summary: Serves as the base class for data pager field types, which represent a navigation control for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> class serves as the base class for all data pager field types. Data pager fields are used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control to represent a navigation control.
Use the classes that are derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> to select which type of pager is displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control. The following table lists available data pager field types.
|Pager field type|Description| |----------------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField>|Lets users navigate through data pages one page at a time, or to jump to the first or last page.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NumericPagerField>|Lets users select a page by page number.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField>|Lets page developers create a custom paging UI.|
You can derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> class to create additional pager field types.
## Examples The following example shows how to use <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NumericPagerField>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField> objects to display page navigation controls in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control. The objects are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> class.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField/CS/DataPagerFieldCS.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField/VB/DataPagerFieldVB.aspx#1)] -->

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> class is abstract, you cannot create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object directly. This constructor is typically called by the constructor of a derived class to initialize the properties that are defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig instance class System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField CloneField() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a copy of the current object that is derived from .
Docs.returns: A copy of the current object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CloneField%2A> method is a helper method that is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.CloneFields%2A> method to create a copy of the current object that is derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField>. To create a copy of the current object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CloneField%2A> method first creates a new instance of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CreateField%2A> method. Then it calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CopyProperties%2A> method to copy the property values of the current object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CopyProperties%2A> method is a helper method that is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CloneField%2A> method to copy the properties of the current object derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object created by the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CreateField%2A> method is a helper method that is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.CloneField%2A> method to create an empty object that is derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField>. The current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object is copied into the empty object.

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the data pager that the object is associated with.
Docs.value: The object that contains the data pager field.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.DataPager%2A> reference is internally set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCollection.OnInsertComplete%2A> method is called.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance string GetQueryStringNavigateUrl(int32 pageNumber) cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a URL that contains a query string field that has the specified page number.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.GetQueryStringNavigateUrl%2A> method is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NumericPagerField> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> pager fields to create the target URL for each button of the pager field. The target URL includes a query string field that contains a name/value pair. The name is the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.QueryStringField%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, and the value represents the value of `pageNumber`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void HandleEvent(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, handles events that occur in the data pager field object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.HandleEvent%2A> method is a helper method that is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.OnBubbleEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to handle events that occur in the pager field object.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the object is tracking its view-state changes.
Docs.value: if the object is tracking its view-state changes; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void LoadViewState(object savedState) cil managed

Docs.param: The saved view-state values for the control.
Docs.summary: Restores view-state information that was saved previously.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.LoadViewState%2A> method restores view-state information for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object that was saved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.SaveViewState%2A> method during a previous page request.
This method is primarily used by the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state. For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnFieldChanged() cil managed

Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.OnFieldChanged%2A> method raises an event that indicates that the state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object has changed. Changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.Visible%2A> property cause this event to be raised. Changes to properties in derived types also raise this event when state changes occur.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.OnFieldChanged%2A> method enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

block.para: When you override in a derived class, call the base class's method so that registered delegates receive the event.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the query string field has been evaluated.
Docs.value: if the query string field has been evaluated; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NumericPagerField> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> pager fields use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.QueryStringHandled%2A> property to determine whether the query string field has been evaluated. If <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.QueryStringHandled%2A> is `false`, the pager field class processes the page number that is contained in the query string field. It also updates the page properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control. The pager field class uses this property only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.QueryStringValue%2A> property is not an empty string or `null`.

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the query string field from the URL of the request.
Docs.value: The value of the query string field.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.QueryStringField%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is not an empty string or `null`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control uses the HTTP GET command to navigate through the pages. A query string field that consists of a name/value pair is added to the URL of the page. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.QueryStringValue%2A> property retrieves the value of the query string field from the URL of the request. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.QueryStringValue%2A> property contains the requested page number.
This property is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NumericPagerField> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.NextPreviousPagerField> pager fields to evaluate the index of the first record for the page of data requested. The page properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control are then updated.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance object SaveViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Saves the changes that were made to the object's view state.
Docs.returns: The view-state changes for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If there is no view state associated with the object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.SaveViewState%2A> method returns `null`.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.SaveViewState%2A> method is primarily used by control developers.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the object is tracking its view-state changes.
Docs.value: if the object is tracking its view-state changes; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23IsTrackingViewState%2A> interface property uses the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property. This contains the actual implementation and can be extended by control developers.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Web.UI.IStateManager.LoadViewState(object state) cil managed

Docs.param: The saved view-state values for the control.
Docs.summary: Restores view-state information that was saved previously.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23LoadViewState%2A> interface method invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.LoadViewState%2A> method. This contains the actual implementation and can be extended by control developers.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance object System.Web.UI.IStateManager.SaveViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Saves the changes that were made to the object's view state.
Docs.returns: The view-state changes for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23SaveViewState%2A> interface method invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.SaveViewState%2A> method. This contains the actual implementation and can be extended by control developers.
## Examples <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.SaveViewState%2A>

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Causes the object to track changes to its view state so that they can be stored in the control's property and persisted across requests for the same page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23TrackViewState%2A> interface method invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.TrackViewState%2A> method. This contains the actual implementation and can be extended by control developers.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void TrackViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Causes the object to track changes to its view state so that they can be stored in the control's property and persisted across requests for the same page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.TrackViewState%2A> method internally sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property to `true` and invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState%2A> method for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField.ViewState%2A> object.

Docs.summary: Gets a dictionary of state information that enables you to save and restore the view state of a object across multiple requests for the same page.
Docs.value: An object that contains the view-state information.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A data pager field's view state is the accumulation of all its property values. To preserve values across HTTP requests for the same page, ASP.NET server controls use this property to store the property values. The values are stored in an HTML hidden input element on the page. For more information, see [ASP.NET View State Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/19d2a6ed-9a77-4c7c-a7f5-74dd4b6c3818).
By default, view state is enabled for all server controls, but there are circumstances when you might want to disable it. For more information, see [ASP.NET Performance Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f882bf1b-a009-4312-ac06-74370ffabc0b).
For more information about dictionaries and how to use them, see [Collections and Data Structures](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/60cc581f-1db5-445b-ba04-a173396bf872).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a data pager field is rendered.
Docs.value: if the is rendered; otherwise, . The default value is .
